meanings.definition: The act of making something old-fashioned or out of date.
meanings.sent1: Her antiquations of the furniture gave the room a vintage feel.
meanings.sent2: The antiquations of technology often lead to the release of new and improved versions.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's antiquations of his dance moves always make us smile.
meanings.sent4: The antiquations of the building's design revealed its historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The artist's antiquations of traditional painting techniques created a unique masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The process of aging or becoming ancient.
meanings.sent1: The antiquations of the book were evident from its yellowed pages.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the antiquations of the statue gave it a weathered appearance.
meanings.sent3: The antiquations of the cheese made it smell stronger but taste better.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins showed clear signs of the antiquations caused by time.
meanings.sent5: The antiquations of the tree's bark told the story of many years gone by.
